revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/50.105.111.139|50.105.111.139]] ([[User talk:50.105.111.139|talk]]) to last version by MapleTreeXZ
revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Will Friedle | image = | caption = | birth_name = William Alan Friedle | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1976|08|11}} | birth_place = [[Hartford, Connecticut]], U.S. | occupation = Actor, voice actor | years_active = 1988–present | spouse = {{marriage|Susan Martens|2016}} }} '''William Alan "Will" Friedle''' (born August 11, 1976) is an [[United States|American]] [[actor]], [[voice actor]], and writer. https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/worst-ever-podcast-with-christine-and-alaa/id1225846060?mt=2&i=1000410056460 at the 27:53 mark He is best known for his comedic roles, most notably the underachieving elder brother [[Eric Matthews (Boy Meets World)|Eric Matthews]] on the long-running TV sitcom ''[[Boy Meets World]]'' from 1993 to 2000. More recently, he has voiced a number of [[animated character]]s such as [[Terry McGinnis|Terry McGinnis/Batman]], the title character of ''[[Batman Beyond]]'', and [[Ron Stoppable]] of ''[[Kim Possible]]''. He voices [[Deadpool]] in ''[[Ultimate Spider-Man (TV series)|Ultimate Spider-Man]]'' and [[Star-Lord]] in the animated version of ''[[Guardians of the Galaxy (TV series)|Guardians of the Galaxy]]'', replacing Chris Cox. He also performed the voices of Doyle in ''[[The Secret Saturdays]]'', [[Lion-O]] in the rebooted ''[[ThunderCats (2011 TV series)|ThunderCats]]'' series, and [[Blue Beetle (Jaime Reyes)|Blue Beetle]] on ''[[Batman: The Brave and the Bold]]''.{{Cite news |publisher=[[Comic Book Resources]] |date=28 January 2009 |url=http://www.comicbookresources.com/?page=article&id=19720 |title=The Bravest & Boldest: Will Friedle |first=Kiel |last=Phegley |accessdate=30 November 2010 }} One of his most recent roles has been the speaking voice of [[Bumblebee (Transformers)|Bumblebee]] in the final episode of ''[[Transformers: Prime]]'' and the movie ''[[Transformers Prime Beast Hunters: Predacons Rising]]'' and in the stand-alone sequel series [[Transformers: Robots in Disguise (2015 TV series)|''Transformers: Robots in Disguise'']], as well as in ''[[Transformers: Rescue Bots]]''. In December 2013, it was announced that Friedle would reprise his ''Boy Meets World'' role of Eric Matthews on the continuation series ''[[Girl Meets World]]''.{{cite web|url=https://tvline.com/2014/12/03/girl-meets-world-eric-returns-mr-feeny-season-2-spoilers/|title=‘Girl Meets World’: Eric Returns With Mr. Feeny — Season 2 Spoilers - TVLine|author=Andy Swift|work=TVLine|accessdate=4 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/GMWWriters/status/540219661225193472?lang=en|title=Girl Meets Writers|work=Twitter|accessdate=4 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/willfriedle/status/540217158672723968?lang=en|title=Will Friedle on Twitter|work=Twitter|accessdate=4 April 2016}} ==Early life== Friedle was born in [[Hartford, Connecticut]], the son of Patricia Joan (née Leary) and Gary Allen Friedle, both lawyers.{{cite web|url=http://articles.courant.com/2011-04-07/entertainment/hc-fake-0407-20110406_1_art-league-mixed-media-artist-art-forger|title=Art-World Movie Shot In State To Be Shown Saturday In New Milford|work=tribunedigital-thecourant|accessdate=4 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/courant/access/932464242.html?dids=932464242:932464242&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:AI&type=historic&date=Sep+06%2C+1964&author=&pub=Hartford+Courant&desc=Friedle-Leary&pqatl=google|title=The Hartford Courant article archive - Friedle-Leary|publisher=|accessdate=4 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/courant/access/965151852.html?dids=965151852:965151852&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:AI&type=historic&date=Jan+17%2C+1971&author=&pub=Hartford+Courant&desc=She+Chose+to+Have+Both&pqatl=google|title=The Hartford Courant article archive - She Chose to Have Both|publisher=|accessdate=4 April 2016}} After committing himself to becoming an actor, Friedle continually commuted from [[Avon, Connecticut]] to [[New York City]] for auditions. He graduated from [[Avon High School (Connecticut)|Avon High School]] in 1994. Friedle attended [[Occidental College]]. In the July 4, 2006 issue of ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'', Friedle mentioned he had thought about attending [[culinary school]]. ==Career== After co-hosting [[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]]'s ''[[Don't Just Sit There]]'' for three seasons (1988–1991), Friedle was cast as Cory Matthews' likeable but underachieving elder brother [[List of Boy Meets World characters|Eric]] on the long-running TV sitcom ''[[Boy Meets World]]'' from 1993 to 2000. In 2004, he co-starred with [[Chris Owen (actor)|Chris Owen]] in the [[independent film]] ''[[National Lampoon's Gold Diggers]]'' (originally titled ''Lady Killers''). He also appeared in a supporting role in the 2005 [[ABC Family]] movie ''[[Everything You Want (film)|Everything You Want]].'' Friedle was cast as Mike in the [[The WB Television Network|WB]] sitcom ''[[Off Centre]]'', but could not accept the role because of a previous commitment to the [[UPN]] series ''[[The Random Years]]''. The role ended up going to [[Eddie Kaye Thomas]].[http://www.digitalspy.com/ustv/news/a6496/friedle-lands-upn-sitcom.html Friedle lands UPN sitcom] Neil Wilkes, DigitalSpy, 4 March 2002 Friedle voiced [[Seifer Almasy]] in the [[English language|English]] version of the video game ''[[Kingdom Hearts II]]'', Gideon Wyeth in the English version of the video game ''[[Advent Rising]]'', and Jaster Rogue in the English version of the video game ''[[Rogue Galaxy]]''. ==Personal life== In 1997, Friedle dated [[United States|American]] actress [[Jennifer Love Hewitt]],{{cite web|url=http://www.nndb.com/people/875/000050725/|title=Will Friedle|publisher=|accessdate=4 April 2016}} and co-starred with her in the romantic teen comedy ''[[Trojan War (film)|Trojan War]]''. Hewitt made a guest appearance as Jennifer Love "Feffy" Fefferman on ''[[Boy Meets World]]'' episode "And Then There Was Shawn". Friedle is best friends with actor [[Jason Marsden]] and was the best man at Marsden's wedding in October 2004. The two have also worked together in numerous productions: ''[[Boy Meets World]], [[Trojan War (film)|Trojan War]], [[Static Shock]], [[Kim Possible]], [[Batman Beyond]], [[Justice League Unlimited]], [[Batman: The Brave and the Bold]], [[ThunderCats (2011 TV series)|ThunderCats]]'' and ''[[Mad (TV series)|Mad]]''. He married his girlfriend, Susan Martens, on September 25, 2016 in Connecticut.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-3807974/Ladies-gents-Mrs-Squirrels-Boy-Meets-World-star-Friedle-celebrates-marriage.html|title=Boy Meets World star Will Friedle celebrates his marriage|publisher=|accessdate=15 August 2017}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" ! colspan="4" style="background: LightSteelBlue;" | Film |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !
